intro: Chaenolobium decemjugum, commonly known as the many-flowered chaenolobium, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and has hairy, narrow leaves. Its showy yellow flowers bloom in clusters, making it a striking addition to gardens. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in humid conditions.
